greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of products of the multisets of prime indices of each prime index of n.
comment: A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
example: 94 has prime indices {1,15} with prime indices {{},{2,3}} with products {1,6} with sum a(94) = 7.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 25 2019
